H0.text: Head is the part of the body that the sternocleidomastoid, the major muscle, laterally flexes and rotates.

H1.text: The tongue is laterally flexed and rotated by the sternocleidomastoid, which is the major muscle that performs this action.

H2.text: Eye is the structure that the sternocleidomastoid, the major muscle, laterally flexes and rotates.

H3.text: The sternocleidomastoid is the major muscle that laterally flexes and rotates the knee.

A4.text: The sternocleidomastoid rotates the head to the opposite side.

A5.text: The sternocleidomastoid is one of the largest and most superficial cervical muscles.
